5.m: I delight to do your will, O my God; your law is within my heart. - Psalm 40:8 (ESV)

l.q: Why is there a need for people to make animal offerings?
l.a: People need to make animal offerings everytime a sin is committed in order to obtain God's forgiveness.

l.q: In verses 27-30, what kind of animal should common people sacrifice as atonement for their sins?
l.a: The person should sacrifice a female goat without blemish.

l.q: In Psalm 40:6-8, who will take the place of animal offerings?
l.a: In Psalm 40:6-8, Jesus Christ will take the place of animal offerings. See also Hebrews 10:1-18.

5.p: God, you are holy and just, and does not take sin lightly. If it were not for Jesus, one missed sacrifice or offering on my part will forever rob me of life so far from your blessings. But there is no denying the truth of your Word, for even the Old Testament is filled with references of your Son, Jesus Christ, your perfect plan of salvation. You have orchestrated everything since the beginning of time - so great is your love for mankind, for you to share with us the riches of your grace. May the glory and honor be yours alone.
